page.title: 19Ecton House and Ecton Hall
page.content: Ecton House, formerly called Rectory House, was built in 1693. It is now owned by the Peterborough Diocese and is used as a conference and retreat centre. Ecton Hall. The present hall was built by the Isted family in 1756 on the site of what was thought to be an old nunnery. The hall is now owned by the Sotheby family who built some estate cottages in the village. The hall is uninhabited and falling down. It is the centre of much controversy as the Borough Council wants it repaired as it is a listed building. The Hall is now up for sale.
